title: GPB Capital Founder Seeks Curbs on Court-Appointed Monitor
sub_head: The firm’s indicted former chief executive says a monitor is no longer needed
body:
GPB Capital Holdings LLC founder David Gentile is asking a judge to rein in the private-equity firm’s court-appointed monitor and stop him from liquidating its investment funds, according to a court document.
Mr. Gentile, who stepped down as GPB’s chief executive after a federal grand jury indicted him on criminal fraud and conspiracy charges early last year, asserts Joseph Gardemal, an Alvarez & Marsal Holdings LLC managing director, has outlasted his usefulness as a monitor and is no longer needed.
